Quick Facts

EXIT   X

COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT MEASURES

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

 

 

Powers regarding documents

 

Inspectors may issue a written notice requiring a person to produce a document within a specified time. They may make copies of, or take extracts from, any document and keep it for as long as they deem necessary.

 

 

Powers of questioning

 

A person does not have to voluntarily provide information. However, if the inspector warns that the person's failure to answer a question without a reasonable excuse may be seen as an offence, compliance is necessary. A person must answer a question, even if the answer or information could incriminate the person or lead to a penalty.

 

Failing to comply without a reasonable excuse can attract a maximum penalty of $10,000 for an individual and $50,000 for a corporation.

 

 

Powers of seizure

 

Inspectors may seize anything at a workplace that they reasonably believe is evidence of an offence. This includes seizing an actual workplace, part of a workplace, plant, substance or structure if they believe:

 

•         it is so defective or hazardous that it is likely to cause serious injury or illness

•         a dangerous incident could occur

 

The object may be physically removed from the workplace or become subject to access restrictions.
